I am proud to announce Marely Gutierrez, an Azusa High School senior,  as our first-place winner. Her charcoal and graphic artwork, Heartfelt  Gaze, will be hung in the Cannon tunnel for the next year for everyone  to see.

Now, it is also not lost on me that I am standing in this Chamber, in  this seat of power from which wars have been launched and the fates of  millions have hung, a Chamber where in the nearly 250 years of this  great Nation, only 3 percent of the people who have ever stood here on  this floor have been women. …Speaker, 24 years ago today, our Nation was changed  forever. I remember that day as a high school student. I  witnessed a stream of people covered in ashes, trying to get home. It  is impossible to forget.…
